nodes.name: Webhook Trigger - Intake Form
nodes.notes:
ENHANCED: Added execution start timestamp for performance tracking.
PURPOSE: Accept incoming lead data from web forms, chatbots, or landing pages.
INPUTS: JSON payload with name, email, phone, interest, referral_source.
OUTPUTS: Parsed body as $json with execution_start_time.
CONFIG: Set ALLOWED_ORIGINS env var for CORS control.

nodes.name: Add Execution Metadata
nodes.notes:
ENHANCEMENT: Capture execution metadata for observability.
Adds: execution timestamp, client IP, workflow version, module identifier.
USE CASE: Performance monitoring, debugging, audit trail.

nodes.name: Validate Required Fields (Enhanced)
nodes.notes:
ENHANCED: Added length validation for name (min 2), email (max 320), phone (min 7).
PURPOSE: Enforce data quality by validating name, email (format), and phone presence.
INPUTS: Webhook body fields.
OUTPUTS: Routes to 'true' branch if valid, 'false' if invalid.
VALIDATION: Email regex, non-empty checks, realistic length constraints.

nodes.name: Format Validation Error (Enhanced)
nodes.notes:
ENHANCEMENT: Detailed error messages with specific field failures.
PURPOSE: Format detailed validation error response.
OUTPUT: Specific field errors for better client-side handling.

nodes.name: Return Validation Error
nodes.notes:
ENHANCED: Added execution time to error response.
PURPOSE: Return 400 error to client when validation fails.
INPUTS: Triggered by validation failure.
OUTPUTS: HTTP 400 with detailed error JSON.
ERROR HANDLING: Client-facing message, no PHI exposure.

nodes.name: Normalize & Enrich Lead Data
nodes.notes:
ENHANCEMENT: New node for data normalization and lead scoring.
FEATURES:
- Improved name splitting (handles multiple spaces)
- Phone normalization (digits only) + display format preservation
- Automatic lead scoring based on interest + referral source
- Default values for optional fields
USE CASE: Improves CRM data quality and enables priority routing.

nodes.name: Upsert Contact to CRM (with Retry)
nodes.notes:
ENHANCED: Added retry logic, lead score, IP tracking, and dual phone fields.
PURPOSE: Create or update contact record in HubSpot CRM.
INPUTS: Validated and enriched lead data.
OUTPUTS: HubSpot contact object with ID.
RETRY: Automatic retry on transient failures.
CONFIG: HUBSPOT_CREDENTIAL_ID, HUBSPOT_CREDENTIAL_NAME.

parameters.name: text

nodes.name: Send Internal Notification (Enhanced)
nodes.notes:
ENHANCED: Lead score display, emoji formatting, priority flag.
PURPOSE: Alert staff via Slack/Teams/SMS about new lead.
FEATURES: Visual indicators, high-priority for score >= 8.
CONFIG: NOTIFICATION_WEBHOOK_URL, NOTIFICATION_CHANNEL.

nodes.name: Append to Data Store (Enhanced)
nodes.notes:
ENHANCED: Split name fields, lead score, client IP, version tracking.
PURPOSE: Log lead to Google Sheets for audit trail.
RETRY: Automatic retry on transient failures.
CONFIG: GOOGLE_SHEET_ID, GOOGLE_SHEET_TAB.

nodes.name: Format Success Response (Enhanced)
nodes.notes:
ENHANCEMENT: Execution metrics, performance categorization.
FEATURES: Duration tracking, fast/normal/slow categorization.
USE CASE: Client-side monitoring, performance optimization.

nodes.name: Return Success Response
nodes.notes:
ENHANCED: Execution time header for client monitoring.
PURPOSE: Return success payload to webhook caller.
FORMAT: Includes contact_id, lead_score, execution_time.

meta.description: Aigent Universal Clinic Template - Module 01 ENHANCED: Intake & Lead Capture with advanced features including lead scoring, data normalization, comprehensive error handling, execution metrics, retry logic, and enhanced observability.
meta.author: Aigent Automation Engineering (Enhanced by Claude/Opus)
enhancements: Automatic lead scoring based on interest + referral source
Phone normalization with display format preservation
Retry logic for CRM and data store operations
Rich notification formatting with emojis and priority
Client IP tracking for audit/abuse detection
Workflow version tracking across all responses
meta.migration_notes: Fully backwards compatible. New environment variables are optional with defaults. Existing credentials work without modification.
